Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Polyhexamethylene Biguanide-Impregnated Gauze for Reducing Pin Site Infection in External Fixation

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the PHMB group (22 limbs) or the control group (18 limbs).

Participants.evidence: 38 patients (40 limbs) undergoing limb lengthening or deformity correction with external fixators at a single center

Intervention.evidence: PHMB-impregnated gauze compared to plain gauze

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of polyhexamethylene biguanide (PHMB)-impregnated gauze compared to plain gauze in reducing pin tract infections.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of pin tract infection, assessed at 2, 4, 8, and 12 weeks post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: The outcome assessor was blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 38 patients (40 limbs) undergoing limb lengthening or deformity correction with external fixators at a single center between July 2009 and June 2010.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The infection rate was significantly lower in the PHMB group (1.0%) compared to the control group (4.5%), with a relative risk of 0.228 (95% CI, 0.118 to 0.443; p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
